document.masterDocTitle: The millipede genus Megaphyllum Verhoeff, 1894 in the Balkan Peninsula, with description of new species (Myriapoda: Diplopoda: Julida: Julidae)

Remarks. Distributed between 180–2100m a.s.l., in diverse habitats from anthropogenic habitats to montane forests. Verhoeff described
M. hercules
as a subspecies of
M. unilineatum
on the basis of a single adult male and numerous females and juveniles (
Verhoeff 1901 a
). In 1967 Strasser elevated
M. u. hercules
to species level, and discussed the differences between
M. unilineatum
,
M. hercules
and
M. rhodopinum (
Strasser 1967
)
. For
M. hercules , Strasser
gave the following characters: dorsally a longitudinal red dot-line, or rarely a reddish continuous line; length of adult males 29–39mm (sometimes 44mm ), females can reach 55mm ; promere wide, medially pointed; opisthomere’s posterior process wide, rounded, ending somewhat lower than the apical processes. Based on investigation of our material we would add the following modifications: colour of the dorsal (dot-) line can vary from yellow to red; about one-third of the investigated adult males were above 39mm ( 43–47mm ); the opisthomere has a distinct feature, a basal, caudo-mesal swelling, which was also observed by
Verhoeff ( 1901 a)
and
Attems ( 1927 )
.
